dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ctypes

Class SInt16

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ctypes.CType
      • dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ctypes.PrimitiveType
        • dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ctypes.SInt16

  • public class SInt16
extends PrimitiveType
    Represents a signed 16-bit integer in the C language.

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

    • Constructor Detail

      • SInt16

        public SInt16(long value)
        Constructor that creates a SInt16 with the given value. This constructor is intended to be used for variables that are enclosed by another type (e.g. as member in a struct or array) because its name will be set by the enclosing type. If you want to create a variable for standalone use you must call constructor SInt16(String, long).
        Parameters:
        value - The value of this variable to create.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • SInt16

        public SInt16(java.lang.String name,
              long value)
        Constructor that creates a SInt16 with the given name and value. This constructor is intended to be used for standalone variables. If this variable is used in an enclosing type (e.g. as member in a struct) then you should rather call constructor SInt16(long).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this variable to create.
        value - The value of this variable to create.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • SInt16

        protected SInt16()
        Constructor that generates a default SInt16 without name and value. This is only allowed for typedefs of extended classes and hence subclasses should provide it public. Variables that are created with this constructor can only be generated as typedef and not as variable definition.
        Since:
        2008.b
